docs.lead_paragraph: Walter W. Heller, the chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, remarked to a Congressional committee last week on "the limitations of the science of economic forecasting."

headline.main: THE NATION; Eyes on Economy Worries Over Deficit Action on Drugs Tests on Animals Jobs on Rails Factor of Competition U.S. vs. Albany, Ga. City Accused Move on Filibuster Sidelights

docs.snippet: Walter W. Heller, the chairman of the President's Council of Economic Advisers, remarked to a Congressional committee last week on "the limitations of the science of economic forecasting."

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9--The Government took the first step today to tighten its control over testing of new drugs on human beings.

headline.main: U.S. TIGHTENING TESTING OF DRUGS ON HUMAN BEINGS; Would Halt Trials of Pills if Doubt of Safety Arose-- Industry Wary of Plan U.S. Tightens Control of Drugs Tested on Patients by Doctors

docs.abstract: Deputy Comr Harvey cites skin disorders as suspected side effect of W S Merrel Co drug Mer-29 to lower cholesterol
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9--The Government took the first step today to tighten its control over testing of new drugs on human beings.
